paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene and reports on the I560T variant associated with congenital short QT syndrome, including functional data and penetrance information.

patients.phenotype: Atrial fibrillation and flutter; family history of sudden death

individual_records.phenotype_details: Atrial fibrillation and flutter; QTc interval of 319 ms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The I560T mutation was identified in a 64 year old male who presented with atrial fibrillation and flutter and whose father and brother had died suddenly.

functional_data.summary: The I560T mutation increases IhERG amplitude and alters voltage-dependence of inactivation.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation was absent in the genomic DNA of 200 controls, indicating segregation with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional studies and family history
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is associated with a gain-of-function effect on hERG channel operation.
key_quotes: The I560T mutation was identified in a 64 year old male who presented with atrial fibrillation and flutter and whose father and brother had died suddenly.
The I560T mutation, involving a residue located in the S5 transmembrane helix, was due to a c.1679T>C transition and was absent in the genomic DNA of 200 controls.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant I560T was successfully extracted.
